tit.cmt: 名前表記訂正しました。

sen.j: 井上玄覚因碩（いのうえ げんかくいんせき、慶長10年（1605年） - 延宝元年（1673年）1月14日）は、囲碁の棋士 (囲碁)。
sen.e: INOUE Genkaku Inseki (1605 - January 14, 1673, according to the old calendar) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player.
INOUE Genkaku Inseki (1605 - January 14, 1673, according to the old calendar) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player.
Genkaku Inseki INOUE (1605 - March 2, 1673) was an Igo (board game of capturing territory) player.
sen.cmt: 名前表記訂正しました。according to the old calendar削除、新暦のみにしました。

sen.j: 家元井上家の2世井上因碩で、古因碩とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He was the disciple of the second INOUE Inseki, the head family of the Go circle, and his was also called Koinseki.
He was the disciple of the second INOUE Inseki, the head family of the Go circle, and his was also called Koinseki.
He was the disciple of the second Inseki INOUE, the head family of the Go circle, and his was also called Koinseki.
sen.cmt: 名前表記訂正しました。

sen.e: Jozu (Go players with 7-dan ranking or higher)
Jozu (Go players with 7-dan ranking or higher)
Jozu (Go players with 7-dan ranking or higher)
He was originally from Yamashiro Province.
He was originally from Yamashiro Province.
He was originally from Yamashiro Province.

sen.j: 中村道碩の弟子で、寛永7年(1630年)に死に臨んだ道碩が禄の相続を願い出て、これを継いだ。
sen.e: He was a follower of Doseki NAKAMURA, and in 1630, when Doseki was dying, Doseki requested Genkaku to succeed his stipend.
He was a follower of Doseki NAKAMURA, and in 1630, when Doseki was dying, Doseki requested Genkaku to succeed his stipend.
He was a follower of Doseki NAKAMURA, and in 1630, when Doseki was dying, Doseki requested Genkaku to succeed his stipend.

sen.j: その後、碁打衆の禄は徳川幕府より家禄とされるようになり、因碩の死後に本因坊道策の弟の井上道砂因碩が井上家を継いだ。
sen.e: Later, the stipend for the go players were succeeded as Karoku (hereditary stipend) as stipulated by the Tokugawa shogunate, and upon the death of Inseki, INOUE Dosa Inseki, the younger brother of Dosaku HONINBO, took over the Inoue house

Later, the stipend for the go players were succeeded as Karoku (hereditary stipend) as stipulated by the Tokugawa shogunate, and upon the death of Inseki, INOUE Dosa Inseki, the younger brother of Dosaku HONINBO, took over the Inoue house

Later, the stipend for the go players were succeeded as Karoku (hereditary stipend) as stipulated by the Tokugawa shogunate, and upon the death of Inseki, Dosa Inseki INOUE, the younger brother of Dosaku HONINBO, took over the Inoue house
sen.cmt: 名前表記訂正しました。

sen.j: これにより、玄覚は1世井上因碩とされるが、井上幻庵因碩の時に道碩を井上家1世とする家系書き換えがなされ、以降玄覚は井上家2世と記される。
sen.e: With this, Genkaku became the first INOUE Genkaku; however, during the time the Inoue house was headed by INOUE Genan Inseki, the family line was revised with Doseki becoming the first generation head of Inoue house and Genkaku becoming the second.

With this, Genkaku became the first INOUE Genkaku; however, during the time the Inoue house was headed by INOUE Genan Inseki, the family line was revised with Doseki becoming the first generation head of Inoue house and Genkaku becoming the second.

With this, Genkaku became the first Inseki INOUE; however, during the time the Inoue house was headed by Genan Inseki INOUE, the family line was revised with Doseki becoming the first generation head of Inoue house and Genkaku becoming the second.
sen.cmt: the first Inseki INOUEに訂正しました。余分なスペースを削除しました。名前表記訂正しました。

sen.j: 1624-30年頃に皇居で道碩との対局があり（因碩先）、ジゴとしている。
sen.e: During the time around 1624 to 1630, there was a match between Doseki (Insekisaki) and Genkaku at the Imperial Palace and the game was a draw.
During the time around 1624 to 1630, there was a match between Doseki (Insekisaki) and Genkaku at the Imperial Palace and the game was a draw.
During the time around 1624 to 1630, there was a match between Doseki (Insekisaki) and Genkaku at the Imperial Palace and the game was a draw.

sen.j: 正保元年(1644年)、寺社奉行より道碩後継の碁打衆頭領の地位の詮議では、玄覚は本因坊算悦とともに辞退、安井算哲も就任はならなかった。
sen.e: In 1644, during the investigation of the successive head of the go house after Doseki, Genkaku and Sanetsu HONINBO both declined, and neither was Santetsu YASUI able to access the post.
In 1644, during the investigation of the successive head of the go house after Doseki, Genkaku and Sanetsu HONINBO both declined, and neither was Santetsu YASUI able to access the post.
In 1644, during the investigation of the successive head of the go house after Doseki, Genkaku and Saneetsu HONINBO both declined, and neither was Santetsu YASUI able to access the post.
(Godokoro Sengi (investigation of go house))
(Godokoro Sengi (investigation of go house))
(Godokoro Sengi (investigation of go house))

sen.j: 没後は、本因坊算砂、算悦、道硯、算哲らと同じく、京都寂光寺に葬られた。
sen.e: After his death, he was buried in the Kyoto Jakko-ji Temple as was Sansa, Sanetsu, Doseki and Santetsu HONINBO.
After his death, he was buried in the Kyoto Jakko-ji Temple as was Sansa, Sanetsu, Doseki and Santetsu HONINBO.
After his death, he was buried in the Kyoto Jakko-ji Temple as was Sansa, Saneetsu, Doseki and Santetsu HONINBO.

sen.j: 『隔蓂記』では鹿苑寺に招かれた碁打衆の一人として玄碩法橋という者がおり、明暦3年(1657年)に2世安井算哲（渋川春海）先番で対局して1勝1敗、万治4年(1661年)に安井算知に先番で負け、寛文5年(1665年)に玄碩の子の玄悦が安井算知の弟子となったなどの記録がある。
sen.e: In the "隔蓂記" there is a character name Genseki Hokkyo as one of the go players invited to play at Rokuon-ji Temple, with the record of him playing with the 2nd generation Santetsu YASUI in 1657, with the result of 1 win and 1 loss, a game was loss to Sanchi in 1661, and in 1665 Doseki's son Genetsu becoming the pupil to Sanchi YASUI.

In the "隔蓂記" there is a character name Genseki Hokkyo as one of the go players invited to play at Rokuon-ji Temple, with the record of him playing with the 2nd generation Santetsu YASUI in 1657, with the result of 1 win and 1 loss, a game was loss to Sanchi in 1661, and in 1665 Doseki's son Genetsu becoming the pupil to Sanchi YASUI.

In the "Kakumeiki" there is a character name Genseki Hokkyo as one of the go players invited to play at Rokuon-ji Temple, with the record of him playing with the 2nd generation Santetsu YASUI in 1657, with the result of 1 win and 1 loss, a game was loss to Sanchi in 1661, and in 1665 Doseki's son Genetsu becoming the pupil to Sanchi YASUI.

sen.j: 算哲に白を持つほどの打ち手である玄碩は道碩の弟子とされるが、玄覚と同一人物かは不明。
sen.e: Genseki, skillful enough to win over Santesu as the white player (second mover, usually the better player of the two), was known to be Doseki's pupil, however, whether he was Genkai or not remains unknown.

Genseki, skillful enough to win over Santesu as the white player (second mover, usually the better player of the two), was known to be Doseki's pupil, however, whether he was Genkai or not remains unknown.
